content.raw:
Thank you Rumman.  I was able to run the examples and all the code looks great.

I do think it is important to get a little high-level documentation up and running before we close out the PR.  I agree that the code is well documented and self-documenting from a developers standpoint, but if we don’t have some simple instructions, I suspect it won’t get used to its full potential.  Many of your users won’t look at the code and may not be familiar enough with C\+\+ and Gazebo plugins to understand the code.

Writing a short tutorial/demo shouldn’t take long.  I would just…

1. Provide a couple sentences of what the feature is and what it does.
2. Provide a working example of how to make it work - what commands to run to execute the demo.

    1. Perhaps here a short example of how to turn the feature on and off.  
    2. Should also mention the SDF parameters and what they control, but don’t need to be exhaustive.
    
3. Provide an image or two of what users should expect to see in the simulation with brief explanation \(a couple sentences\) of how to interpret the results.  

I don’t think it will take more than 15-30 minutes.  If you can get us something started we can improve from there.

Also, I’d like to keep the PR open until we finish a minimal tutorial/demo in the wiki.  This will help us track things consistently.  

Thank you!
